sentences: Pablo Nassarre (or Nasarre; 1650–1730) was a Spanish priest, organist, and Baroque composer.
Nassarre was born blind in Alagón, Zaragoza, in 1650.
He moved to Daroca to be taught by Pablo Bruna, also a blind composer.
At age 22, Nassarre became a Franciscan and joined the Royal Convent of San Francisco in Zaragoza, where he was the organist until his death.
